description._content: Photograph of H. McDonald, one of a group of photos of the Deseronto branch of the Sons of Scotland. A notice in The Tribune of November 27, 1903, states that the group met on the second Thursday of each month in the Masonic Building (the Clement Block). A Hugh McDonald, a saw fitter, is listed in the 1901 census for Deseronto. He was born on 21 July 1857 in urban Ontario, of Scottish descent. He was earning $700. He was living with his wife, Ann J. McDonald (b. July 1853) and his children: Davies (b. 13 May 1876), an apprentice machinist earning $300; Mary J. (b. 27 April 1874); Almer (b. 1 Aug 1883); George H. (b.2 Sept 1885) and Duncan (b. 27 July 1889).
